meanings.sent1: Be careful of the snag on the fence.
meanings.sent2: The tree branch had a snag that tore my shirt.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel got stuck on the snag and couldn't move.
meanings.sent4: Her words hit me like a snag in the smooth fabric of our conversation.
meanings.sent5: The snag on the rock scratched my hand as I climbed.

meanings.sent1: The unexpected test was a snag in my plans.
meanings.sent2: She faced many snags while trying to finish the project.
meanings.sent3: Finding a parking spot was a snag, but we managed to squeeze in.
meanings.sent4: The snag in their relationship was finally addressed during the therapy session.
meanings.sent5: Overcoming the snag in the road required teamwork and patience.

meanings.definition: To catch or tear on a sharp projection.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally snagged my sweater on the nail.
meanings.sent2: She snagged her dress on the thorny bush.
meanings.sent3: He snagged the last cookie before anyone else could grab it.
meanings.sent4: The fish snagged the hook and fought against being reeled in.
meanings.sent5: The kite snagged on the tree branch and got stuck.

meanings.definition: To obtain or secure quickly or unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: She managed to snag the last ticket to the concert.
meanings.sent2: He snagged a great deal on the new phone.
meanings.sent3: I tried to snag a discount at the store, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The detective finally snagged the criminal after weeks of investigation.
meanings.sent5: The team was able to snag victory in the final seconds of the game.
